DOC.brief_summary: The clinical, radiographic, and HRQL outcomes will be compared in operative and nonoperative adult spinal deformity patients.
DOC.brief_title: Multi-Center Prospective Evaluation of Operative Versus Nonoperative Treatment for Adult Spinal Deformity
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of adult degenerative or idiopathic scoliosis with a curvature of the spine measuring greater than or equal to 20 degrees Sagittal Vertical Axis (SVA) > 5cm Pelvic Tilt > 25 degrees Thoracic kyphosis > 60 degrees Age 18 or greater at the time of enrollment. Diagnosis of scoliosis other than degenerative or idiopathic (i.e. paralytic/neuromuscular, congenital) Age <18 yrs at time of surgery or initial consultation
